java/liquibase/util/JdbcUtils.java

00001 package liquibase.util;
00002 
00003 import liquibase.exception.JDBCException;
00004 
00005 import java.sql.*;
00006 import java.util.Collection;
00007 
00008 public abstract class JdbcUtils {
00009 
00015     public static final int TYPE_UNKNOWN = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
00016 
00023     public static void closeStatement(Statement stmt) {
00024         if (stmt != null) {
00025             try {
00026                 stmt.close();
00027             }
00028             catch (SQLException ex) {
00029 //                logger.debug("Could not close JDBC Statement", ex);
00030             }
00031             catch (Throwable ex) {
00032                 // We don't trust the JDBC driver: It might throw RuntimeException or Error.
00033 //                logger.debug("Unexpected exception on closing JDBC Statement", ex);
00034             }
00035         }
00036     }
00037 
00044     public static void closeResultSet(ResultSet rs) {
00045         if (rs != null) {
00046             try {
00047                 rs.close();
00048             }
00049             catch (SQLException ex) {
00050 //                logger.debug("Could not close JDBC ResultSet", ex);
00051             }
00052             catch (Throwable ex) {
00053                 // We don't trust the JDBC driver: It might throw RuntimeException or Error.
00054 //                logger.debug("Unexpected exception on closing JDBC ResultSet", ex);
00055             }
00056         }
00057     }
00058 
00078     public static Object getResultSetValue(ResultSet rs, int index) throws SQLException {
00079         Object obj = rs.getObject(index);
00080         if (obj instanceof Blob) {
00081             obj = rs.getBytes(index);
00082         } else if (obj instanceof Clob) {
00083             obj = rs.getString(index);
00084         } else if (obj != null && obj.getClass().getName().startsWith("oracle.sql.TIMESTAMP")) {
00085             obj = rs.getTimestamp(index);
00086         } else if (obj != null && obj.getClass().getName().startsWith("oracle.sql.DATE")) {
00087             String metaDataClassName = rs.getMetaData().getColumnClassName(index);
00088             if ("java.sql.Timestamp".equals(metaDataClassName) ||
00089                     "oracle.sql.TIMESTAMP".equals(metaDataClassName)) {
00090                 obj = rs.getTimestamp(index);
00091             } else {
00092                 obj = rs.getDate(index);
00093             }
00094         } else if (obj != null && obj instanceof java.sql.Date) {
00095             if ("java.sql.Timestamp".equals(rs.getMetaData().getColumnClassName(index))) {
00096                 obj = rs.getTimestamp(index);
00097             }
00098         }
00099         return obj;
00100     }
00101 
00108     public static boolean isNumeric(int sqlType) {
00109         return Types.BIT == sqlType || Types.BIGINT == sqlType || Types.DECIMAL == sqlType ||
00110                 Types.DOUBLE == sqlType || Types.FLOAT == sqlType || Types.INTEGER == sqlType ||
00111                 Types.NUMERIC == sqlType || Types.REAL == sqlType || Types.SMALLINT == sqlType ||
00112                 Types.TINYINT == sqlType;
00113     }
00114 
00121     public static Object requiredSingleResult(Collection results) throws JDBCException {
00122         int size = (results != null ? results.size() : 0);
00123         if (size == 0) {
00124             throw new JDBCException("Empty result set, expected one row");
00125         }
00126         if (results.size() > 1) {
00127             throw new JDBCException("Result set larger than one row");
00128         }
00129         return results.iterator().next();
00130     }
00131 
00132 
00133 }
